org.forgerock.openam.core.rest.devices.services

Class EncryptedDeviceStorage

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.openam.core.rest.devices.services.EncryptedDeviceStorage
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AuthenticatorOathService, AuthenticatorPushService

    public abstract class EncryptedDeviceStorage
extends Object
    Abstract class providing configuration for the encryption of stored device information.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected static class  EncryptedDeviceStorage.SupportedEncryptionScheme
      Encryption schemes that are currently supported to use to secure stored data.

      Returns a strategy which will be used to serialise a device correctly by defining its encryption parameters (if encrypted) or otherwise indicating that it should be simply JSON encoded.

    • Field Detail

      • options

        protected Map<String,Set<String>> options

    • Constructor Detail

      • EncryptedDeviceStorage

        protected EncryptedDeviceStorage(ServiceConfigManager configManager,
                                 String realm,
                                 String debugLocation)
                          throws SMSException,
                                 SSOException
        Generates a new EncryptedDeviceStorage for a given service.
        Parameters:
        configManager - Version of the service this class needs to talk to via the ServiceConfigManager
        realm - Realm in which the service exists.
        debugLocation - Debug file handle.
        Throws:
        SMSException - In case of exceptions communicating with the SMS.
        SSOException - In case there was an issue retrieving an valid access token to get to the service.

    • Method Detail

      • getDeviceSerialisationStrategy

        protected DeviceSerialisation getDeviceSerialisationStrategy(String scheme,
                                                             String keystoreFile,
                                                             String keystorePass,
                                                             String keystoreType,
                                                             String keyPairAlias,
                                                             String privateKeyPass)
        Returns a strategy which will be used to serialise a device correctly by defining its encryption parameters (if encrypted) or otherwise indicating that it should be simply JSON encoded.
        Parameters:
        scheme - The key of the data in the options map to use.
        keystoreFile - Location of the keystore file.
        keystorePass - Password to the keystore file.
        keystoreType - Type of the keystore.
        keyPairAlias - Name of the keypair.
        privateKeyPass - Password used to retrieve the private key from the keypair.
        Returns:
        an appropriate DeviceSerialisation.
